lines.text: 1. Corporate Governance at Woodside

paragraphs.text: 1. Corporate Governance at Woodside

lines.text: Woodside is committed to a high level of corporate governance and
fostering a culture that values ethical behaviour, integrity and respect. We
believe that adopting and operating in accordance with high standards of
corporate governance is essential for sustainable long-term performance
and value creation.

paragraphs.text:
Woodside is committed to a high level of corporate governance and 
fostering a culture that values ethical behaviour, integrity and respect. We 
believe that adopting and operating in accordance with high standards of 
corporate governance is essential for sustainable long-term performance 
and value creation.

lines.text: This Statement reports on Woodside’s key governance principles and
practices. These principles and practices are reviewed regularly and
revised as appropriate to reﬂect changes in law and developments in
corporate governance.

paragraphs.text:
This Statement reports on Woodside’s key governance principles and 
practices. These principles and practices are reviewed regularly and 
revised as appropriate to reﬂect changes in law and developments in 
corporate governance.

lines.text: Woodside’s Compass is core to our governance framework. It sets out our
mission, vision and strategic direction and core values of integrity, respect,
working sustainably, working together, discipline and excellence. It’s the
overarching guide for everyone who works for Woodside.

paragraphs.text:
Woodside’s Compass is core to our governance framework. It sets out our 
mission, vision and strategic direction and core values of integrity, respect, 
working sustainably, working together, discipline and excellence. It’s the 
overarching guide for everyone who works for Woodside.

lines.text: Woodside’s corporate governance model is illustrated below. The
Woodside Management System (WMS) describes the Woodside way of
working, enabling Woodside to understand and manage its business to
achieve its objectives. It deﬁnes the boundaries within which Woodside
employees and contractors are expected to work. The WMS establishes a
common approach to how we operate, wherever the location.

paragraphs.text:
Woodside’s corporate governance model is illustrated below. The 
Woodside Management System (WMS) describes the Woodside way of 
working, enabling Woodside to understand and manage its business to 
achieve its objectives. It deﬁnes the boundaries within which Woodside 
employees and contractors are expected to work. The WMS establishes a 
common approach to how we operate, wherever the location.

lines.text: The company, as a listed entity, must comply with the Corporations Act
2001 (Cth), the ASX Listing Rules, and other Australian and international
laws. The ASX Listing Rules require the company to report on the extent
to which it has followed the Corporate Governance Recommendations
contained in the ASX Corporate Governance Council’s third edition of
its Corporate Governance Principles and Recommendations (ASXCGC
Recommendations). Throughout the year, Woodside complied with all the
ASXCGC Recommendations.

paragraphs.text:
The company, as a listed entity, must comply with the Corporations Act 
2001 (Cth), the ASX Listing Rules, and other Australian and international 
laws. The ASX Listing Rules require the company to report on the extent 
to which it has followed the Corporate Governance Recommendations 
contained in the ASX Corporate Governance Council’s third edition of 
its Corporate Governance Principles and Recommendations (ASXCGC 
Recommendations). Throughout the year, Woodside complied with all the 
ASXCGC Recommendations.

lines.text: A checklist cross-referencing the ASXCGC Recommendations to the
relevant sections of this Statement and the 2016 Remuneration Report is
provided on pages 13 to 15.

paragraphs.text:
A checklist cross-referencing the ASXCGC Recommendations to the 
relevant sections of this Statement and the 2016 Remuneration Report is 
provided on pages 13 to 15.

lines.text: Information on Woodside’s governance framework is also provided in
the Governance and Compliance section of Woodside’s website.

paragraphs.text:
Information on Woodside’s governance framework is also provided in 
the Governance and Compliance section of Woodside’s website.

lines.text: The website contains copies of Board and committee charters and copies
of many of the policies and documents mentioned in this Statement. The
website is updated regularly to ensure it reﬂects Woodside’s most current
corporate governance information.

paragraphs.text:

of many of the policies and documents mentioned in this Statement. The 
website is updated regularly to ensure it reﬂects Woodside’s most current

lines.text: 2. Board of directors

paragraphs.text: 2. Board of directors

lines.text: 2.1 Board role and responsibilities
The Constitution provides that the business and afairs of the company
are to be managed by or under the direction of the Board. The Board has
approved a formal Board Charter which details the Board’s role, powers,
duties and functions. Other than as speciﬁcally reserved to the Board
in the Board Charter, responsibility for the management of Woodside’s
business activities is delegated to the Chief Executive Ofcer (CEO) who is
accountable to the Board. The Board Charter and the delegation of Board
authority to the CEO are reviewed regularly.

paragraphs.text:
2.1 Board role and responsibilities 
The Constitution provides that the business and afairs of the company 
are to be managed by or under the direction of the Board. The Board has 
approved a formal Board Charter which details the Board’s role, powers, 
duties and functions. Other than as speciﬁcally reserved to the Board 
in the Board Charter, responsibility for the management of Woodside’s 
business activities is delegated to the Chief Executive Ofcer (CEO) who is 
accountable to the Board. The Board Charter and the delegation of Board 
authority to the CEO are reviewed regularly.

lines.text: The central role of the Board is to set the company’s strategic direction, to
select and appoint a CEO and to oversee the company’s management and
business activities.

paragraphs.text:
The central role of the Board is to set the company’s strategic direction, to 
select and appoint a CEO and to oversee the company’s management and 
business activities.

lines.text: In addition to matters required by law to be approved by the Board, the
following powers are reserved to the Board for decision:

following powers are reserved to the Board for decision:

lines.text: 2.2 Board composition
The Board is comprised of ten non- executive directors and the CEO.
Details of the directors, including their qualiﬁcations, experience, date
of appointment and independent status, are set out in Table 1. Detailed
biographies are available in the Annual Report 2016 on pages

paragraphs.text:
2.2 Board composition
The Board is comprised of ten non- executive directors and the CEO. 
Details of the directors, including their qualiﬁcations, experience, date 
of appointment and independent status, are set out in Table 1. Detailed 
biographies are available in the Annual Report 2016 on pages  
66 and 67.

lines.text: The Board and its committees actively seek to ensure that the Board
continues to have the right balance of skills, knowledge, experience
and diversity necessary to direct the company in accordance with
high standards of corporate governance and to oversee Woodside's
management and business activities.

paragraphs.text:
The Board and its committees actively seek to ensure that the Board 
continues to have the right balance of skills, knowledge, experience 
and diversity necessary to direct the company in accordance with 
high standards of corporate governance and to oversee Woodside's 
management and business activities.

lines.text: In assessing the composition of the Board, the directors have regard to
the following principles:

In assessing the composition of the Board, the directors have regard to 
the following principles:

lines.text: The directors on the Board collectively have a combination of skills and
experience in the competencies set out in Table 2 on page 3. These
competencies are set out in the skills matrix that the Board uses to assess
the skills and experience of each director and the combined capabilities of
the Board.

lines.text: 3. Committees of the Board

paragraphs.text: 3. Committees of the Board

lines.text: 3.1 Board committees, membership and charters
The Board has the ability under the company’s constitution to delegate its
powers and responsibilities to committees of the Board. This allows the
directors to spend additional and more focused time on speciﬁc issues.

paragraphs.text:
3.1 Board committees, membership and charters
The Board has the ability under the company’s constitution to delegate its 
powers and responsibilities to committees of the Board. This allows the 
directors to spend additional and more focused time on speciﬁc issues.

lines.text: The Board has four standing committees to assist in the discharge of its
responsibilities. These are the:

paragraphs.text:
The Board has four standing committees to assist in the discharge of its 
responsibilities. These are the:

lines.text: + Audit & Risk Committee;

paragraphs.text: + Audit & Risk Committee;

lines.text: + Nominations Committee;

paragraphs.text: + Nominations Committee;

lines.text: + Human Resources & Compensation Committee; and

paragraphs.text: + Human Resources & Compensation Committee; and

lines.text: + Sustainability Committee.

paragraphs.text: + Sustainability Committee.

lines.text: The committees operate principally in a review or advisory capacity,
except in cases where powers are speciﬁcally conferred on a committee
by the Board.

paragraphs.text:
The committees operate principally in a review or advisory capacity, 
except in cases where powers are speciﬁcally conferred on a committee 
by the Board.

lines.text: Each committee has a charter, detailing its role, duties and membership
requirements. The committee charters are reviewed regularly and updated
as required. Prior to the commencement of each year, the committees set an
annual agenda for the coming year with reference to the committee charters
and other issues the committee members or Board consider appropriate for
consideration by the committees.

paragraphs.text:
Each committee has a charter, detailing its role, duties and membership 
requirements. The committee charters are reviewed regularly and updated 
as required. Prior to the commencement of each year, the committees set an 
annual agenda for the coming year with reference to the committee charters 
and other issues the committee members or Board consider appropriate for 
consideration by the committees.

lines.text: Each committee’s charter is available in the Governance and Compliance
section of Woodside’s website.

paragraphs.text:
Each committee’s charter is available in the Governance and Compliance 
section of Woodside’s website.

and experience. Each standing committee is comprised of:

lines.text: Members of the Audit & Risk Committee between them should have the
accounting and ﬁnancial expertise, and a sufcient understanding of the
industry in which Woodside operates, to be able to efectively discharge
the committee’s responsibilities.

accounting and ﬁnancial expertise, and a sufcient understanding of the 
industry in which Woodside operates, to be able to efectively discharge 
the committee’s responsibilities.

lines.text: The chairman of the Audit & Risk Committee cannot be the Chairman of
the company.
